item.title: Adding announcement for killing a certain NPC [Czar/Delta] [317]
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:550807”]What object owns the “IsDead” variable?
Is there an “IsDead” variable for NPCs?

I believe there is an NPC class (NPC.java) somewhere in your server… Could you look in there and see if it has an IsDead boolean, or something of similar sort?

If it does… You could change the code to this:

if (server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].npcType == 1645 && server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].IsDead) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = ("The xxxx has been slain by " + playerName); }

The reason it doesn’t work currently is because the “IsDead” variable is probably related to the Client object (A.K.A, the player). So that boolean is only true when the player dies, or false when they’re currently alive. Hence why it constantly sends as you attack the monster.

Have you tried dying while attacking said monster? I bet (with the current code) it will probably send your message.[/quote]
If that’s the case all he has to do is find the code block that handles fighting NPCs and add a simple boolean check.

item.dc:creator: @Welliton_inc Welliton_inc
item.description:
@Welliton_inc wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:550807”]I’m unfamiliar with the structure of a Czar/Delta. But the best place to add it would be either where the NPC is killed, or where the NPC drops the items for the player(s).

If you could post that code, I may be able to point you into the right direction a bit more.[/quote]

Thanks for your quick reply Sk8r, this is the code I made:

if (server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].npcType == 1645) { if (IsDead == true) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = ("The xxxx has been slain by " + playerName); } }

I put it underneath where it makes sure slayer monsters cannot be attacked if you don’t have the required slayer level.

Also if I just change “IsDead” to false, when I attack the monster it sends the message, so the code must partly work, I suppose
